main: ^Hello! It's you again. Do you want to recap the info about Del Pilars?

c-0: ^ Alright then, which one you want to tackle first?
c-1: ^Alright then! Just go to me if you want to recap.

c-0: ^Marcelo H. Del Pilar known by his pen name Plaridel. He was a Filipino writer, lawyer, journalist, and freemason. He was born on August 30, 1850, and brought up in Bulakan, Bulacan.
^Del Pilar also a contributor as an editor for the propaganda movement newspaper La Solidaridad.
^He was sent to Spain because of his anti-friar activities. (Friars are members of any of certain religious orders of men, or often called priests), and lastly, he died on July 4, 1986 at aged of 45.

c-1: ^Gregorio Del Pilar or Gregorio Hilario del Pilar y Sempio was born on November 14, 1875 and died in December 2, 1899 at aged of 24. He was one of the youngest generals in the revolutionary army during the Philippine-American War.

c-0: ^Because of his youth, he became known as the Boy General or Goyo. Lastly, he was the nephew of Marcelo H. Del Pilar.

c-2: ^That's all. If you want to recap some of their information, just let me know.
